ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned Korean language and some culture as well.

This course was a continuation of KREN 110. It taught me the vocabulary and grammar necessary to take part in a much wider range of conversations including making plans, ordering at a restaurant, shopping, traveling, talking to a boss, etc.
Korean language skills, reading writing listening and speaking
I have been able to write coherent and full sentences in Korean while also gaining a more advanced vocabulary.
Learned Korean at a fast and well balanced pace.

Friendship with classmates and instructor! 
Language practicing skills!
Learning to collaborate with others and create an encouraging atmosphere!
Basic korean grammar & vocab
I loved this course, finally understood Korean sentence structure and certain particles initially taught in KREN 110.
I learned more about Korean grammar
Better Korean grammar, vocabulary, and culture + linguistics understanding

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course is very enjoyable and fun. It depends on the professor if it is a great class.

Strengths: This course is very well taught, fun, and engaging! We covered lots of material at a good pace and had many opportunities to practice. Professor Lim is amazing and I have no complaints about this course! Weaknesses: None

Strengths: im ssn follows a very methodological approach but the class never felt boring or dry. It is very clear what grammar points we are learning each day and we are given ample opportunities to practice. It's always a very fun, inclusive and affirmative learning environment which I feel is perfect for a beginner level class like this. 
Weakness: I would hope to have more actual speaking practice - possibly also hindered by our larger class size.
Maybe a little more emphasis on speaking.
I really enjoyed the pacing, as well as the community sense with my peers.

Strengths: Almost everything! Learning environment! Feedback and corrections were so helpful! Flexible schedules!

Weaknesses: If I were to be really picky, perhaps some help with speaking practice could be helpful! But this is super picky!
I think the tests are too far spaced. Id prefer more lower stakes vocab quizzes so we can learn more as we go.
No weaknesses!
It was an incredible class! My only wish was that we could have more of it !

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes take it with professor Lim, he is the best.
Yes! KREN 120 is one of the best classes that I've taken at Yale! Not only do you learn a lot, it is also a fun course! I always looked forward to going to class.
I would! Im ssn's class is a complete joy. Our class environment is also always lively which makes speaking out easier and learning smoother.
Yes I would. The teacher was very nice and it was a great environment to learn
I would absolutely recommend this to other students and I have.

Absolutely! Especially with Professor Lim! Learning a new language can be daunting. But Korean 120 makes the language so approachable and comforting. I don't feel pressured to be perfect, which is perfect when learning a new language. Trying new things within the class that go outside of the learning is met with enthusiasm and warm encouragement and feedback!
Absolutely yes
Definitely, the Korean language program at Yale is my favorite language program that actively fosters an understanding of what's taught at a steady, manageable pace.
Yes! Especially with Professor Lim
Yes! The Korean department faculty is warm, kind, and incredible
